content.description: Step 1:<math alttext="H 2 gas plus I C l gas react to produce H I gas plus H C l gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>(slow)Step 2:<math alttext="H I gas plus I C l gas react to produce H C l gas plus I 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>(fast)
content.question: The reaction is carried out at constant temperature inside a rigid container. Based on this mechanism, which of the following is the most likely reason for the different rates of step 1 and step 2 ?

choices.label: The only factor determining the rate of step 2 is the orientation of the <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> polar molecules during a collision, but it has a negligible effect when <math alttext="H 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules collide.

The amount of energy required for a successful collision between <math alttext="H 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than the amount of energy required for a successful collision between <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The fraction of molecules with enough energy to overcome the activation energy barrier is lower for <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> than for <math alttext="H 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The frequency of collisions between <math alttext="H 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than the frequency of collisions between <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The amount of energy required for a successful collision between <math alttext="H 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than the amount of energy required for a successful collision between <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="I C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
